channel.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post
channel.description: The Washington Post Sports section provides sports news, video, scores, analysis and updates about high school, college, and pro sports teams, including the Capitals, Nationals, Redskins, United and Wizards. Post Sports also offers blogs and discussions about the latest sports news.

image.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post

item.title: Redskins Blog: Redskins add cornerback Justin Rogers
item.description:
The  Redskins announced that they have signed cornerback Justin Rogers to their 53-man roster.

A fourth-year veteran out of Richmond, Rogers entered the league in 2011 as a seventh-round pick of the Buffalo Bills. Rogers spent two seasons with the Bills before spending brief stints with the Texans and Dolphins. He spent a portion of this offseason with the Chiefs, but was cut before the start of the season and had yet to land a job with another team.

Read full article >>
item.dc:creator: Mike Jones
item.ExtractedText: By Mike Jones December 10 at 10:56 AM Follow @mikejoneswapo Redskins place kicker Kai Forbath and defensive back Justin Rogers look up at a 54-yard field goal attempt during a preseason game at FedEx Field on Aug. 24, 2013. (Ricky Carioti/The Washington Post) The Redskins announced that they have signed cornerback Justin Rogers to their 53-man roster. A fourth-year veteran out of Richmond, Rogers entered the league in 2011 as a seventh-round pick of the Buffalo Bills. Rogers spent two seasons with the Bills before spending brief stints with the Texans and Dolphins. He spent a portion of this offseason with the Chiefs, but was cut before the start of the season and had yet to land a job with another team. For his career, the 5-foot-11, 180-pound Rogers has appeared in 39 games, starting seven, recording 64 tackles, three interceptions and one forced fumble. The Redskins had a roster opening after cutting linebackers Everette Brown, Steve Beauharnais and cornerback Greg Ducre on Tuesday. More from The Post:
